DataElement.preferredName: Myeloablative Bone Marrow Transplantation Contraindication Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A Yes/No question that asks whether myeloablative bone marrow transplant is contraindicated to the patient at the time of enrollment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Myeloablative Bone Marrow Transplantation Contraindication Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A conditioning regimen with high doses of chemotherapy or radiation to eliminate host hematopoietic stem cells prior to restitution via transplantation._A procedure to replace diseased or pathologic bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow cells._Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Myeloablative Conditioning Bone Marrow Transplantation Medical Contraindication
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A conditioning regimen with high doses of chemotherapy or radiation to eliminate host hematopoietic stem cells prior to restitution via transplantation.:A procedure to replace diseased or pathologic bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow cells.:Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.

Concepts.definition: A conditioning regimen with high doses of chemotherapy or radiation to eliminate host hematopoietic stem cells prior to restitution via transplantation.
A procedure to replace diseased bone marrow with transplanted healthy bone marrow cells.
A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an obvious contraindication to myeloablative BMT at the time of enrollment?
